page.title: 02JOBS IN LOWER LYDBROOK
page.content: We went out on Thursday 6th June 1985 on our Domesday Project to interview people about their jobs.Some people worked from 2-7 days a week.Most people would like more pay for less hours."Better conditions", said a carpenter, and the bus driver we interviewed would like better coaches to drive.At the Courtfield Arms,a pub in Lower Lydbrook ,we interviewed the accountant who seemed quite happy with her job,apart from wishing for more pay.Most people worked on an average of 9 hours a day and 6-7 day week. Not very many people had fringe benefits. Most people worked on the premises and walked to work.For most people it takes 10-15 minutes to get to work.
